summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Board of Adjustment (Panel A) of the City of Dallas will convene on November 14, 2023, with a briefing at 10:30 A.M. followed by a public hearing at 1:00 P.M. The meeting will take place in the Council Chambers at Dallas City Hall and will also be accessible via videoconference. The purpose is to discuss various zoning and adjustment cases, as well as to address procedural items.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
The agenda includes a staff presentation, public hearing for case dockets, and public testimony. Notable items on the docket involve requests for special exceptions and variances related to side-yard setbacks, fence height, and parking regulations.

**Important Details**:  
Significant proposals include applications for special exceptions from residents seeking to modify zoning regulations affecting their properties. Specific cases include requests for adjustments at 4707 Allencrest Lane, 2764 Catherine Street, and 5526 E.R.L Thornton Frwy, among others. The meeting will also cover the approval of minutes from previous meetings.

**Action Items**:  
The Board will seek approval for the minutes from the special call meeting on October 31, 2023, and the regular meeting on September 19, 2023. Additionally, decisions will be made on the various uncontested and individual case requests presented during the public hearing. Public participation is encouraged, with registration required for those wishing to speak.
